page.title: 03Old Housing in Wolverhampton
page.content: The western suberbs are residential.The oldest houses are Victorian,built betwee 1854-91.These are mansions,semi- detached and detached villas and terraced houses.They are built of red brick and have slate roofs.The oldest of the small houses have flat sash windows and no front gardens,the later ones have bay windows and small front gardens.Some have name plates above the door,often with the date when they were built.The terreced houses have a covered entry leading to the back;they have no garages.The mansions have extensive woodland grounds sloping down over a sandstone ridge.The mansions are no longer used as single residences.One has been changed into a private hospital. others have been turned into flats or have had houses built in their gardens.One was demolished and 22 houses were built in its place.
